string.text: Found an interesting PDA here, but it's encrypted - wanna take a look?

Let me see... Hmm... The "Milspec" label doesn’t bode well... I recognize the model - it’s a GETAC. A terrible PDA for the Zone. I can’t decipher it - no idea what kind of protection system the Chinese cooked up, and I’ve never heard of anyone cracking it. So, here’s the deal: I know a way to reflash it - with complete data loss, of course - it’ll cost you 25,000 rubles since the process isn’t easy and requires... let’s say, "special" skills. Oh, and I’m also willing to buy it from you for 10,000 rubles - it’s full of high-quality components.
Here’s the money. \n%c[d_orange][25,000 rubles]

Nice, perfect... Alright, plugging in my special flash drive... Rebooting... Resetting BIOS to factory defaults, wiping the memory... Booting in safe mode... All done - here you go. No idea why you need this PDA, but if it breaks - don’t even come to me for repairs.
You know what - I’ll ask about it later.
Yeah, okay then...
Take it - I don’t really need it.
Smart choice! Here’s your money.
I have a couple of questions about the PDA...
What exactly do you need?
Well, i changed my mind...
My PDA screen is broken - can you replace it?

What!? You can't break it! There's tempered glass in there, if you throw it against the wall, the brick will break! Okay, give it here... So... Well, the insides are intact, nothing serious, but replacing the screen will cost you 5,000 rubles! I can't imagine how you broke it!
Take the money for the screen. \n%c[d_orange][5,000 rubles]
That's great, here you go, it's as good as new now.
It's too expensive... I'll probably come back about it later..
"Too expensive"!? Although, what am I surprised about - breaking tempered glass...
My PDA just don't work!

Give it here... Yeah, I get it - it fried out, that happens sometimes, the voltage jumps - did you get caught by emission or hit by electra? Whatever the reason, I'll need to replace almost all the electrical components. Well, you're in trouble - you'll have to shell out at least 5,000 rubles and at max 40,000 rubles - depends on PDA model. And also, don't even ask me to fix anything other than regular stalker PDAs! There was a stalker once, he brought God knows what, some kind of ultra-modern PDA, a military model - i hate such models! They're so fancy that fixing them isn't worth a second of my time.
Okay, take the money - fix my PDA 0.1. \n%c[d_orange][5,000 rubles]
Oh, okay, here's the money - fix my PDA 1.0. \n%c[d_orange][10,000 rubles]
Expensive, but fair - fix my PDA 2.0. \n%c[d_orange][20,000 rubles]
Oh, so expensive, but there is not much choice - fix my PDA 3.1. \n%c[d_orange][40,000 rubles]
How much!? I think I can do without a PDA for now...
That's great! Here you go, it should work like new now!
Well, as you wish, but you won't last long without PDA... If you have extra money, come back.
My PDA has a blue screen and I can't do anything about it.
Well, well, well... looks like they didn't bless you with intellect or basic common sense... Alright then, give me two and a half grand and I'll fix everything here.
Here's the money. \n%c[d_orange][2,500 rubles]
I've changed my mind...

*Presses the reboot button, enters BIOS, then presses a few more buttons* \nAll done, fixed. And don't you dare say I didn't do anything - stupidity has its price. A sucker's not a mammoth - he won't go extinct.
Oh... You have no idea how much I love all of you with your blue screens...
The functionality of the device has been restored.
PDA screen has been replaced.
Signal booster
Allows establishing a satellite connection without any issues, providing access to GPS almost anywhere.
Communication channel encryptor

In areas controlled by the Monolith, PDAs do not work and display an error - it is said that Monolith members can track active PDAs in their territory and remotely disrupt their operation. However, the Communication channel encryptor protects the PDA from this fate.
Foil shielding

Proper shielding with foil reduces the risk of the Emission and Psy-Storm affecting the device's sensitive components almost to zero, thereby increasing its survivability in the extreme conditions of the Zone.
Lead coating
High doses of radiation can disrupt the device's operation or damage its components - diggers from the Scrapyard developed an effective shielding method to prevent any radiation-related damage.
Cardan's current limiter
A special miniature current limiter for devices, designed by technician Cardan. Extremely expensive and impractical to install on most devices, but indispensable for expensive and fragile equipment.
Personalization

All PDAs come with a predefined personalization configuration that cannot be altered by default. However, technicians and stalkers long ago discovered a way to bypass this restriction: to unlock all parameters, it is sufficient to change just one value in the PDA's firmware from false to true.
